p: From 2005 to 2007, the Italian government issued a compulsory license for three drug types, including an anti-infection antibiotic, a drug for the treatment of migraine headaches, and a prostate drug. The Italian government also authorized the export of these drugs to other EU member states. These actions are countermeasures to prevent monopolies under the provisions of Article 40 in the Protocol Amending the TRIPS agreement (James 2007).
